name: Hotel Flex

reviews.text: I had read some terrible reviews about this property before I stayed there, so I was a bit nervous about it...but was pleasantly surprised when I arrived.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite close to the Hiroshima Train Station...only about a 5 minute walk on foot. The problem was, when we exited out of the train station, we didn't know which direction to go towards (even tho we had a map). We must have asked about 10 people where the bridge was (the bridge you have to cross to get to the hotel), and no one seemed sure which bridge we were referring to...even when we showed them the map they could'n't really help us.
reviews.title: Ghastly

reviews.text: We were asked to prepay for our 2 nights stay when we checked in.
reviews.title: OK for One Night

reviews.text: When we got into our rooms, we found them to be larger than expected (based on some of the previous reviews I had read). Hoewver, once we put our suitcases down, we realized why people thought the rooms were so small.
reviews.title: Nice, clean but tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Flex is a business hotel located very close to Hiroshima train station. It's fairly no frills, but a perfectly adequate base for one or two night's in Hiroshima.
reviews.title: Good budget choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our twin room was a decent size by japanese standards. It had a small table and chairs and a separate desk where there was a LAN connection that was free to use. I was perfectly happy with this budget option and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value

likes.disliked: — Small rooms, but this is Japan and I didn't pay very much!

reviews.text: It's an easy walk to the tram stop at the station, from where it's about a 20 minute ride to the Peace Park and museum. This is a must-see when you are in Hiroshima. In fact, it's a must-see full stop. It will be the most horrific museum you have ever been to, but also the most inspiring.
reviews.title: Small room but great view

likes.liked: — A relatively inexpensive and clean lodging with public transportation within moderate walking distance.
likes.disliked: — Room maybe too small for group of more than two people.

reviews.text: It's also about a 20 minute walk to the main drag of restaurants and bars, although there is a pretty row of riverside restaurants just a 5 minute walk from the hotel as well.
reviews.title: Good budget option
decent
reviews.text: Stayed in a double room for three nights. Like the rest of the hotel, rooms are nice and modern, and very clean. Beware though that rooms are also very small, like many Japanese mid-range hotels!

description: Hotel Flex is located on the riverbank where the Kyobashi river and the Enko river diverge. Facing the rich greenery of its surroundings, it is a certainly a city type designer's hotel, being positioned so as to afford the guest easy access to downtown Hiroshima. Hotel Flex is only a seven-minute walk from JR Hiroshima station, making the hotel one of the most convenient as a base for both sightseeing and business. We offer guestrooms from a compact single room, a maisonette, and also a personalized room with a terrace. We also have a living-room like open cafe and banquette rooms, all arranged in our ten-story premises . We are always there for our guests to make their stay in Hiroshima as comfortable and safe as possible.
